channel.title: How to make first login with my client load the cache?
channel.description: Hello! Is it possible to make it so I can delete my cache, so the client download is only 620KB, and on first login it creates the cache?

item.title: How to make first login with my client load the cache?
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

Naw it just makes the users of it feel leet. For this task, MySQL is not the answer. Think about it:

Normal download: Page requested -> File sent
MySQL download: Page requested -> PHP queries MySQL -> MySQL returns and decodes the data for PHP -> File sent

Read full topic
item.source: How to make first login with my client load the cache?

item.title: How to make first login with my client load the cache?
item.dc:creator: @RID22 RID22
item.description:
@RID22 wrote:

[quote=“The cook from runescape, post:3, topic:280964”]Of course you can do it, just make the client download the cache after the client is downloaded. It’s pretty pointless though because the users will still need to download the full cache indirectly or not.

Also, don’t use MySQL .[/quote]

Mysql is leet?

Read full topic
item.source: How to make first login with my client load the cache?

item.title: How to make first login with my client load the cache?
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

Of course you can do it, just make the client download the cache after the client is downloaded. It’s pretty pointless though because the users will still need to download the full cache indirectly or not.

Also, don’t use MySQL .

Read full topic

item.title: How to make first login with my client load the cache?
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

Well, yes it is. You could put the cache on a MYSQL server, when someone connects to your client it downloads the cache of SQL server, not sure how to do it, i just know it’s been done (worldscape_client_v3)
